msg: This section will allow you to create 'Plans' and Set a PCF Cost Burndown Target Mode.
Plans are a way for you to estimate what size and quantity of PCF tenant(s) your PCF foundation will host.
PCF Costs represent your 'Estimated' Pivotal license costs for your Foundation.
IaaS Costs represent your 'Estimated' vSphere, AWS, vCloud Air, or Openstack infrastructure costs for your PCF Foundation.
Opex Costs represent your other variable costs for your Foundation like: FTEs, DataCenter Costs, Support, etc...
This value represents your total cost of ownership for the Forecast Duration & Cost values entered above (PCF + IaaS + Opex)
This value represents your TCO in a per month view (TCO / Forecast Duration)

This value is the 'base' GB/Hour cost.  It assumes that all resources are 100% utilzed in your foundation and is the basis for the estimated cost in the 'Plans' section.  Do not use this value without consulting the 'Plans' section

This value is the estimated cost after calculating your ramp up plans.  Assuming you are not at 100% utilization on day 1, plans will allow you to predict consumption.   It is a more accurate value that the 'Base GB/Hour' in the 'Costing' section after plans have been entered
This section allows you to forecast your initial PCF foundation tenant cunsumption and rate of growth

This section will calculate an estimated Profit/Loss for your foundation.  If a value of '~ -1 months' is arrived at for your profit target month,  it signifies that profitability will be reached AFTER the forecast duration value in the 'Costing' section.
